1.name: Hammer
1.description: A small, lightweight tool used in the building industry. Can also be used as a weapon.

2.name: Baseball Bat
2.description: A long, solid wooden bat. As a weapon, it can land quite a blow on your enemy.

3.name: Crowbar
3.description: Used for opening crates and large boxes. The sharp hook at one end makes this a great weapon.

4.name: Knuckle Dusters
4.description: They won't know what hit them with these strong, hard, brass knuckle dusters. They won't even see it coming!

5.name: Pen Knife
5.description: High quality knife--a great survival tool. Ideal for climbers, adventurers, military personnel, and close combat in dark alleys.

6.name: Kitchen Knife
6.description: Do your attempts to prepare food like your favourite TV chef end up more like hack and saw than slice and dice? If so, a sharp new knife could be your saviour.

7.name: Dagger
7.description: A short, sharp metal dagger useful for quick attacks. Straight in, straight out.

8.name: Axe
8.description: Used mainly for chopping tree roots and splitting kindling. Can bash and split many other substances, too.

9.name: Scimitar
9.description: The deeply-curved, high-carbon steel blade of the scimitar can terrify your opponent as you attack with a swashbuckling slash.

10.name: Chainsaw
10.description: A compact chainsaw lets you cut quickly in tight spots. Its standard diamond chain is more than a match for almost anything you might need to slice up.

11.name: Samurai Sword
11.description: A ninja-grade, full-tang samurai sword, created for us by a master artisan. The sword balances perfectly, takes and holds a razor edge, and can divide an eyelash or a full skull in one swipe.

12.name: Glock 17
12.description: The Glock 17 is a lightweight semi-automatic pistol holding up to 20 rounds in a magazine.

13.name: Raven MP25
13.description: The Raven MP25 holds 6 rounds per magazine. It can deliver powerful, quick blows to the opponent at short range.

14.name: Ruger 57
14.description: A fast firing pistol chambered for the 5.7mm cartridge, holding 20 rounds per magazine. An accurate and moderately powerful weapon.

15.name: Beretta M9
15.description: The M9 Beretta is the standard Army sidearm. Accurate and fast firing. 17 rounds per magazine.

16.name: USP
16.description: A good short range weapon that holds 15 rounds per magazine. Very accurate and has fast semi-automatic firing.

17.name: Beretta 92FS
17.description: A direct-feed, double-stacked pistol with a 20-round magazine. This model has improvements to prevent the slide flying off if it cracks.

18.name: Fiveseven
18.description: A small and light firearm that holds up to 20 rounds per magazine. Widely used by counter-terrorists all around the world.

19.name: Magnum
19.description: A very slow but powerful weapon. It holds only 6 rounds, but delivers a mighty blow to the enemy.

20.name: Desert Eagle
20.description: Fast-firing and very powerful. If you hit your opponent, he goes down and stays down. The magazine only holds eight rounds but the strength of each impact makes up for that.

21.name: Dual 92G Berettas
21.description: One of the greatest pistols in the world. And when you are packing a pair, the results are incredible: 46 powerful shots to take your opponent down. The Dual 92G Berettas are very hard to get hold of, so cost a premium. But the extra impact is worth the extra price.

22.name: Sawed-Off Shotgun
22.description: Loads and fires two cartridges at a time. If you hit your opponent, you will open up a huge hole.

23.name: Benelli M1 Tactical
23.description: Simple and sturdy. Takes seven cartridges and delivers each round with power.

24.name: MP5 Navy
24.description: Lightweight and air-cooled, one of the most widely used submachine guns in the world. 30 rounds per magazine.

25.name: P90
25.description: Effective close-range automatic weapon. 50-round magazine. Not particularly accurate, but its fast firing will cause heavy damage on anything it hits.

26.name: AK-47
26.description: Powerful, accurate and virtually unbreakable. This 30-round magazine fed rifle is a favourite among discerning hit men.

27.name: M4A1 Colt Carbine
27.description: The Colt is a powerful and accurate rifle. It's one of the best weapons around, a good choice!

28.name: Benelli M4 Super
28.description: The Auto Shotgun is the best close-range weapon around. Although you may have to reload often as it only holds 7 rounds, the amount of rounds you can pump into your enemy in just a few seconds is amazing.

29.name: M16 A2 Rifle
29.description: Much like the Colt, but more powerful and accurate. 30 rounds per magazine, with a fast-fire option.

30.name: Steyr AUG
30.description: The Steyr AUG holds 30 rounds. It can be very accurate, although its standard scope is a little weak. A great weapon for the price.

31.name: M249 SAW
31.description: The M249 Squad Automatic Weapon is a light machine-gun that combines the precision and mobility of a rifle with the relentless ferocity of rapid machine-gun fire. A favorite of the US Military, this gas-operated LMG can cut down several targets in a matter of seconds.

32.name: Leather Vest
32.description: Simple and lightweight. If you're lucky, it will protect you from a few shots.

33.name: Police Vest
33.description: Strong and durable body armor that will absorb a lot of damage to your torso.

34.name: Bulletproof Vest
34.description: Body armor that can absorb a certain amount of heavy-weapons fire, although it will not turn you into Iron Man.

35.name: Box of Chocolate Bars
35.description: A box of Mars bars. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
35.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

36.name: Big Box of Chocolate Bars
36.description: A very large box of Mars bars. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
36.effect: Increases happiness by 35 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

37.name: Bag of Bon Bons
37.description: A pack of Bon Bons. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
37.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

38.name: Box of Bon Bons
38.description: A box of four luxurious Bon Bons. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
38.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

39.name: Box of Extra Strong Mints
39.description: Wow, whoever needs these must have very bad breath. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
39.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

40.name: Pack of Music CDs
40.description: Some of the hottest bands around, all in one pack of CDs.

41.name: DVD Player
41.description: Sony DVD player with MP3 reading ability.

42.name: MP3 Player
42.description: Brand new MP3 player made by Sony. Comes with a 512 MEG card.

43.name: CD Player
43.description: This stylish home stereo system was top of the range back in 1994, with its CD player capable of reading even the most scratched up compact discs in your collection.

44.name: Pack of Blank CDs : 100
44.description: Writable CDs for recording music or saving data.

45.name: Hard Drive
45.description: A large hard drive to extend your computer's storage capacity.

46.name: Tank Top
46.description: A stylish low cut tank top.

49.name: Full Body Armor
49.description: Full body armor made of high-grade bulletproof material. It will absorb some of the damage from hits taken by the wearer.

50.name: Outer Tactical Vest
50.description: Despite the Combat Vest offering improved protection, its predecessor the Outer Tactical Vest is far from obsolete. The increased survivability and enhanced maneuverability provided makes it a more than worthwhile addition to your combat wardrobe.

51.name: Plain Silver Ring
51.effect: Can be used to propose to someone with.

52.name: Sapphire Ring
52.effect: Can be used to propose to someone with.

53.name: Gold Ring
53.effect: Can be used to propose to someone with.

54.name: Diamond Ring
54.effect: Can be used to propose to someone with.

55.name: Pearl Necklace
55.description: Matched cultured pearls in an understated but elegant setting.

56.name: Silver Necklace
56.description: A silver necklace featuring a pattern of semi-precious stones.

58.name: Plastic Watch
58.description: This watch is absolutely accurate at least twice a day.

59.name: Stainless Steel Watch
59.description: Continues working when dropped, stepped on, or hit with a rubber mallet.

60.name: Gold Watch
60.description: Elegance and luxury at sixty seconds per minute.

61.name: Personal Computer
61.description: A high-tech personal computer. Can be used to program viruses.
61.effect: Can be used to program viruses.

63.name: Minigun
63.description: This gun has a 200-round magazine. When you are done with a burst, your enemy will be in fragments.

64.name: Pack of Cuban Cigars
64.description: A pack of great quality, very expensive Cuban cigars.

65.name: Television
65.description: A king size Sony TV screen.

66.name: Morphine
66.description: A shot of morphine to kill your pain, and shorten your hospital stay.
66.effect: Reduces hospital by 70 mins and restores 15% life. Increases medical cooldown by 20 mins.

67.name: First Aid Kit
67.description: Use this first aid kit to bind your wounds and shorten your hospital stay.
67.effect: Reduces hospital by 40 minutes and restores 10% life. Increases medical cooldown by 15 mins.

68.name: Small First Aid Kit
68.description: This kit will stop you bleeding on your clothes and will shorten your hospital stay by a small amount.
68.effect: Reduces hospital by 20 minutes and restores 5% life. Increases medical cooldown by 10 mins.

69.name: Simple Virus
69.description: A very simple virus that was written by an amateur.

70.name: Polymorphic Virus
70.description: Polymorphic viruses are semi-sentient: they adapt themselves with each infection. With a virus-writing toolkit you can even design new viruses.

71.name: Tunneling Virus
71.description: This virus will attempt to tunnel under anti-virus monitoring programs in order to bypass their monitoring functions.

72.name: Armored Virus
72.description: This virus attempts to make disassembly difficult. Great for systems with weak virus protection.

73.name: Stealth Virus
73.description: In order to avoid detection, a virus will often take over virus protection system functions likely to spot it and use them to hide itself. An extremely hard virus to write.

74.name: Santa Hat '04
74.description: A well crafted Santa hat made especially for the 2004 Christmas!

75.name: Christmas Cracker '04
75.description: An expensive Christmas cracker made especially for the 2004 Christmas!

76.name: Snow Cannon
76.description: A very rare special weapon, made and crafted by Santa himself!

77.name: Toyota MR2
77.description: This streamlined import has stunning top end speed but has miserable stopping power.

78.name: Honda NSX
78.description: This underdog costs a fraction of the price of the other cars in its class, and its acceleration and top speed leave a bit to be desired. However, its handling and braking are hard to match, helping the NSX rate well on the lap time table for Class A.

79.name: Audi TT Quattro
79.description: This sleek sports car is not only a hit with the ladies but can accelerate quicker than any in its class. It boasts a streamlined shape paired with a very clever Quattro system. European road laws ruin this car with a top speed limit of 155mph.

80.name: BMW M5
80.description: This rocket ship can reach a monumental top end speed once de-restricted. The fastest 4-door saloon of its type. Sadly, its immense power struggles to be transferred onto the road during the first couple of gears, slowing its acceleration.

81.name: BMW Z8
81.description: This rear wheel drive "Beamer" does struggle for grip off the line but due to its poise and balance it is stable under braking making it very quick in the corners.

82.name: Chevrolet Corvette Z06
82.description: This car can power its way to a sky high top speed with its glorious 7 litre V8. Again, like most American cars it sadly does not handle particularly well.

83.name: Dodge Charger
83.description: This Dodge can reach breakneck speeds in a straight line, although satisfactory cornering is an expensive optional extra, as this beast turns into a good old American rodeo round the corners.

84.name: Pontiac Firebird
84.description: This American classic tends to under-steer severely in the corners and wallow round any intricate track. However, its impressive top speeds on the straights do a lot to compensate for weak cornering.

85.name: Ford GT40
85.description: This Le Mans derived Ford handles like a racing car should but is slightly let down by its acceleration, especially when considering it is incredibly light for its class.

86.name: Hummer H3
86.description: This giant has stopping power twice the force of its rivals; its handling however is poor on tarmac due to soft off road suspension and high centre of gravity.

87.name: Audi S4
87.description: This 2.7 litre twin turbo Ferrari killer is extremely planted under braking into corners allowing a great exit speed once its turbos kick in, it does however bog down off the line due to the four wheel drive system when compared to others in its class.

88.name: Honda Integra R
88.description: This import is described by many as the "closest you'll get to a race car out of factory" - due to its sharp and responsive handling.

89.name: Honda Accord
89.description: This car has a wide wheelbase, allowing for superb handling with stiff suspension springs preventing body roll. The car's weight, however, reduces its speed off the line.

90.name: Honda Civic
90.description: This import has a staggering top speed, but with non independent suspension it suffers from poor handling.

91.name: Volkswagen Beetle
91.description: One of the few good things to come out of WWII, this "people's car" handles like it's on rails. It has a limited top speed of 155 mph due to German restrictions.

92.name: Chevrolet Cavalier
92.description: The Chevy has a substantially larger 2,800cc engine than most in its class giving it a great top speed. However like most American cars it lacks the simple ability to corner.

93.name: Ford Mustang
93.description: This American treasure has its place in most males' dream garage. The car boasts a stunning top speed, and once it's off the line it's unstoppable...literally unstoppable, as the brakes are sponges, no wonder Shelby had to make severe modifications for track racing!

94.name: Reliant Robin
94.description: This three wheeled beauty can turn on a two pence piece with stunning handling. It comes under scrutiny however, under heavy braking where they have been known to topple over.

95.name: Holden SS
95.description: This Aussie powerhouse reaches a breathtaking top speed. (If it ever gets there after leaving most of its tires on the starting line).

96.name: Coat Hanger
96.description: A metal coat hanger, often used for picking the locks of cars.

97.name: Bunch of Flowers
97.description: A bunch of flowers, a perfect gift!

98.name: Neutrilux 2000
98.description: Very rare: a Leprechaun's most powerful weapon, created out of green nuclear energy. Or at least, that's how the legend goes.

99.name: Springfield 1911
99.description: Steel and light weight aluminium frames, stainless, blued and parkerized finishes, V-12 barrel porting... What more could you want?

100.name: Egg Propelled Launcher
100.description: Very rare: the Easter Bunny's most powerful weapon, created out of jelly bean and chocolate egg technology.

101.name: Bunny Suit
101.description: Very rare, and created out of the strongest fur yet discovered, this serves as the Easter Bunny's most stylish and most protective armor.

102.name: Chocolate Egg '05
102.description: Every person's favourite treat, made for the 2005 Easter celebration!

103.name: Firewalk Virus
103.description: This type of virus is unknown.

104.name: Game Console
104.description: This Game Console is a generic gaming device exclusive to Torn City, and was made from parts cannibalized from an Xbox, PlayStation, and a Sega Saturn. Game Consoles are unique in that they actually bring people happiness when they put effort into them, unlike careers, relationships, or children.

105.name: Xbox
105.description: A games console used for playing games.

106.name: Parachute
106.description: A collapsible device used to retard the descent of a falling body.
106.effect: Permanently increases Dexterity by 1%. Increases booster cooldown by 6 hours.

107.name: Trench Coat
107.description: A thick trench coat that covers most of the body.

108.name: 9mm Uzi
108.description: This Uzi is a compact, boxy, light-weight sub machine gun used throughout the world as a police and special forces firearm.

109.name: RPG Launcher
109.description: The anti-tank RPG launcher is one of the most common and most effective infantry weapons in contemporary conflicts.

110.name: Leather Bullwhip
110.description: A whip made of rawhide. In the right hands, it can be a stealthy and deadly weapon. In the wrong hands...you may lose an eye!

111.name: Ninja Claws
111.description: Traditional ninja weapon for close combat, with four needle-sharp spikes.

113.name: Pet Rock
113.description: One of the rarest items in Torn, first discovered by Matt. Warning: this pet is extremely dangerous! Only the very brave or the very stupid should take it on. Matt takes no responsibility for the loss of life or fingertips caused by this pet.

114.name: Non-Anon Doll
114.description: The perfect gift for when you want to add insult to injury. Patented by Someone...

115.name: Poker Doll
115.description: Feisty red haired doll made in the image of Peachy complete with bellybutton poking action!

116.name: Yoda Figurine
116.description: Have a doll like Yoda You must.

117.name: Trojan Horse
117.description: This sweet gift from Tebbs seems innocently useful. Inside, it is highly infectious!

118.name: Evil Doll
118.description: Replica doll of the Evil Female Admin known as Wynn. Believed to be responsible for lost stats, site lag, mass kicks on IRC and random deletions.

119.name: Rubber Ducky of Doom
119.description: Most powerful weapon in the game can only be used by those with the knowledge to unleash its fearsome Duck Powers. Most often used after being asked the same n00b question for the 5th time in a row. Has also been seen dive bombing random people in IRC.

120.name: Teppic Bear
120.description: Only known of by a very select few, this Teddy Bear stands as proof that even the toughest of players, such as Teppic, do indeed have a softer side.

121.name: RockerHead Doll
121.description: It has no uses and does nothing just like the staff member it resembles.

122.name: Mouser Doll
122.description: Similar to the one used by Mouser to relieve the stress of dealing with uncooperative staff, annoying n00bs, and day to day business of being a Coder in Torn City.

123.name: Elite Action Man
123.description: Mimics the actions of the real man. Has been known to abuse Caps Lock Abusers.

124.name: Toy Reactor
124.description: Miniature model of a Nuclear Reactor similar to the one that Sec. Les_Claypool will be working on when he leaves for the Navy.

125.name: Royal Doll
125.description: This doll will give its user the feeling of being royalty just like KingAce while in possession. Player will receive special treatment from friends and rivals while carrying this special item!

126.name: Blue Dragon
126.description: A blue dragon spawned from the evil TC admin named blue comes packed with evil intentions and wild powers.. Some say rubbing the dragons head makes one 100 times stronger than any normal man!

127.name: China Tea Set
127.description: Be just like Chedburn, sit in the garden and sip tea with this China Tea Set.

128.name: Mufasa Toy
128.description: Replica of a plush toy owned by Randi it looks just like the majestic lion Mufasa... before he was trampled of course.

129.name: Dozen Roses
129.description: A dozen roses. This bouquet is available in assorted colors, from red for that special someone to black to send to your enemy after you hospitalize him or her.

130.name: Skanky Doll
130.description: Just like the one owned by Infrit this doll comes with black hair blood red lipstick mini skirt and boob tube.

131.name: Lego Hurin
131.description: This life like model is comprised completely of legos. Comes with upgrades such as the multi hunting goggles and evilarium connects to the brain. Read instructions for more details. Not intended for use by children age 6 and under.

132.name: Mystical Sphere
132.description: A rare object created by Phyrax when he was a helper... Only possessed by a select few in all of Torn City. Every now and then lights and mist shoot out of the sphere and at this time the holder may obtain all knowledge and wisdom.

133.name: 10 Ton Pacifier
133.description: Used for that special baby out there.. the one you would like to crush because you just cant get them to stop crying. Drive this pacifier in their mouth and you will get dead silence. Created by Rock for all the babies out there.

134.name: Horse
134.description: First seen by those who crossed the Godfather, this strange object greatly increases your desire to annoy people in the chat rooms, while simultaneously draining away all your religious beliefs.

135.name: Uriel's Speakers
135.description: These tripped out speakers will blow you away with thundering bass and a beat that won't quit. Putting out 5000W with a crushing 600 decibels.

136.name: Strife Clown
136.description: This Ominous Clown is full of discord. This rare item channels all the pain and torture this world has to offer.

137.name: Locked Teddy
137.description: This bear is covered in chains connected with padlocks. He has been seen locking forum topics around Torn City, but has yet to have any of his locks picked.

138.name: Riddle's Bat
138.description: This baseball bat belongs to Riddle. All know it and most fear it. It causes panic in the IRC realm. Random kicks occur when he is in a bad mood or when mass slapping occurs. Don't mess with the bat!

139.name: Soup Nazi Doll
139.description: Often seen running loose on IRC, usually before kicking rule breakers with the message No Soup For You!! Believed to have been released by Lestat.

140.name: Pouncer Doll
140.description: Be careful of Pouncer. She might pounce on you unexpectedly, or hit you with a pillow or ducks, just like her creator SexySassy.

141.name: Spammer Doll
141.description: A very friendly doll with good interactions, until you make it mad. It can hit back pretty hard, and It will start spamming you, even when you think it should be sleeping, just like Templar.

142.name: Cookie Jar
142.description: Cookie Jar - Just like the one Is0lati0n has at home, this jar is stocked full of chocolate cookies for late nights working in the IRC channel.

143.name: Vanity Mirror
143.description: Complete with 24 carat gold rim and handle with YT's initials engraved on it.

144.name: Banana Phone
144.description: Bright yellow, shaped like a banana, and plays Titan's favourite song when it rings. Known to annoy other staff members... may be part of the reason he loves it.

145.name: Xbox 360
145.description: A games console used for playing games.

146.name: Yasukuni Sword
146.description: A rare Japanese blade of exceptional quality and craftsmanship.

148.name: Dance Toy
148.description: Although its name refers to Syrup it's nothing near slow. Just press the button on the back and watch this crazy toy dance himself to death!

149.name: Lucky Dime
149.description: Found deep within a lost cavern in Torn City was a rare bag of dimes that were stolen during the first bank robbery in Torn City. They were thought to have been lost forever, but a few have survived and are said to bring luck to those who play roulette in the Casino.

150.name: Crystal Carousel
150.description: Created by w1ld_h0rs3s this replica Carousel shows her favourite horses running wild and free.

151.name: Pixie Sticks
151.description: Small plastic tubes filled with flavoured sugar. Available in orange, raspberry, grape and strawberry. Provides a large happiness increase when consumed.
151.effect: Increases happiness by 150 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

152.name: Ice Sculpture
152.description: Some believe that the reclusive artist who carved these sculptures meant them to depict friendliness and good will. However, some who gaze on these rare pieces feel an icy coldness and a sinking detachment from the world. Only the artist knows his true intent.

153.name: Case of Whiskey
153.description: Recovered during a raid at his Mansion these are the last cases of Whiskey that mdshare produced before being captured by Torn City Police for violation of the alcohol ordinance.

154.name: Laptop
154.description: A high-tech wireless laptop. You can use it on your long travels to check your mail and see how things are going at home.
154.effect: Can be used to access additional services while traveling and program viruses.

155.name: Purple Frog Doll
155.description: A very rare species of frog that lives in Torn City. Sometimes seen on IRC hopping into people's pockets. Usually friendly, but can become extremely violent if provoked.

156.name: Hooorang's Key
156.description: Hooorang's skeleton key lets you bypass any locked doors and open lockers and safes. Nothing can stop its holder. Holding this item makes you feel invincible.

157.name: Patriot Whip
157.description: UTBracket's own design, comes in either Union Jack or St. George style. Don't mess with the owner of this collectible or expect to have your day ruined by some painful marks on your butt and the ability to sit down removed!!

158.name: Statue Of Aeolus
158.description: Aeolus Keeper of The Wind possess the power to control the strength and direction of the wind. A Greek Mystical Artifact with powers believed to be related to the wind.

159.name: Bolt Cutters
159.description: A pair of quality bolt cutters. Made of tempered steel with cushion-grip handles and durable, heat-treated jaws.

160.name: Photographs
160.description: Four photographs of a man handing over a briefcase.

161.name: Black Unicorn
161.description: A friend for life and a ferocious fighter feared by all foes.

162.name: WarPaint Kit
162.description: The perfect accessory when going off to war. Fashioned after Scarlet's own personal kit, containing facial paints made of wolf's blood. Once applied, the user is said to gain the prowess of the wolf.

163.name: Official Ninja Kit
163.description: The Official Hiro Ninja Kit is a custom fit accessory set for any wannabe ninja. Contains: ninja suit for those stealthy attacks, grappling hook for those difficult larcenies, ninja guide book as penned by Hiro himself. Warning - not for novices.

164.name: Leukaemia Teddy Bear
164.description: Soft and fluffy, it likes to be cuddled and can comfort you on those lonely nights. But beware: mistreatment of your Leukaemia Teddy Bear will result in a mighty slap from its paws of steel.

165.name: Chocobo Flute
165.description: Long thought to be lost forever this small item was found in the far reaches of Torn City by CloudFFVII. Many believe peace of mind and swiftness in battle are brought to the holder of this charm.

166.name: Annoying Man
166.description: This little annoying man can be seen on IRC and on MSN annoying people and getting into trouble just like Manjot.

167.name: Article on Crime
167.description: An article written by the reporter George on specific criminals.

169.name: Barbie Doll
169.description: Equipped with Kung Fu Grip, and hot pink nail polish, this doll resembles the Admin Clansdancer.

170.name: Wand of Destruction
170.description: A very rare special weapon, this wand was created by The Great Pumpkin himself to wreak havoc on Torn City.

171.name: Jack-O-Lantern '05
171.description: Given out by The Great Pumpkin, to good boys and girls all across Torn City.

172.name: Gas Can
172.description: An ordinary looking gas can such as what one would find at an ordinary gas station.

173.name: Butterfly Knife
173.description: A small knife, deadly in the right hands. The handles fold up to conceal the blade of this dangerous weapon.

174.name: XM8 Rifle
174.description: Lightweight assault rifle, deadly when fired up close. Can break through the toughest armor.

175.name: Taser
175.description: An electroshock gun, non lethal, but will land your opponent in the hospital for a while just as quickly as a more aggressive weapon will.

176.name: Chain Mail
176.description: Chain Mail consists of a series of individual metal rings linked together to form a mesh, resulting in a flexible yet resilient barrier capable of protecting the wearer during hand-to-hand combat. This form of armor was most commonly used by European warriors between 300 BC - 1600 AD, but today is mostly worn by overweight war reenactors who like to play dress-up on the weekends.

177.name: Cobra Derringer
177.description: A small, lightweight pistol. For some people two bullets are all you need.

178.name: Flak Jacket
178.description: Marine issued armor. Sturdy and effective against most small caliber rounds.

179.name: Birthday Cake '05
179.description: A slice of cake left over from Torn's first birthday.

180.name: Bottle of Beer
180.description: Just the thing for when you're looking to kick back after a hard day in the City. Provides a small nerve increase when consumed.
180.effect: Increases nerve by 1 and booster cooldown by 1 hour.

181.name: Bottle of Champagne
181.description: Celebrate an occasion or show your special someone just how much you care with this bottle of champagne. Imported from France. Provides a small nerve increase when consumed.
181.effect: Increases nerve by 1 and booster cooldown by 1 hour.

183.name: Single Red Rose
183.description: For when words alone just aren't enough to say how you feel.

184.name: Bunch of Black Roses
184.description: Not sure your opponent got the meaning of that 4 hour hospital stay? Make SURE you get your point across with this bouquet of black roses.

185.name: Bunch of Balloons '05
185.description: Large bunch of brightly coloured balloons left over from the First Birthday of Torn City. How they stay inflated after the party's over, no one will ever figure out.

187.name: Teddy Bear Plushie
187.description: Soft plush teddy bear for your special someone to cuddle up with when you're not around.

188.name: Cracked Crystal Ball
188.description: A small glass globe with several deep cracks running through it. How can this be of any use?

189.name: S&W Revolver
189.description: Smith and Wesson revolver, commonly used in the game of Russian Roulette.

191.name: Memory Locket
191.description: It has a picture of a happy family inside it.

192.name: Rainbow Stud Earring
192.description: This earring is a symbol of Pride and Love.

193.name: Hamster Toy
193.description: Small plush hamster in a plastic ball. Replica of the one that powers parts of the TC Database and cause for most of the lag when he takes a weekend off. Known to annoy kittens and ducks alike he seems to like only one rather isolated admin.

194.name: Snowflake '05
194.description: A small crystal snowflake made especially for the 2005 Xmas season.

195.name: Christmas Tree '05
195.description: A fully decorated Christmas tree, perfect for decorating your home for the 2005 Christmas season.

196.name: Cannabis
196.description: Said to improve one's concentration and nerve.
196.effect: Increases nerve by 2-3. Includes side effects.

198.name: Ketamine
198.description: Raises one's defense temporarily, resulting in lower strength and speed.
198.effect: Temporarily increases Defense by 50%. Includes side effects.

199.name: LSD
199.description: Increases one's energy, nerve and happiness.
199.effect: Increases energy by 50, nerve by 5, and happiness by 200-500. Includes side effects.

200.name: Opium
200.description: Said to relieve a large amount of pain.
200.effect: Removes all hospital time and replenishes life to 50%. Temporarily increases Defense by 30%.

201.name: PCP
201.description: Momentarily improves one's strength and dexterity.
201.effect: Temporarily increases Strength and Dexterity by 20%. Increases happiness by 250.

202.name: Mr Torn Crown '07
202.description: Awarded to GZUS [18690] for winning the Mr Torn City awards 2007!

203.name: Shrooms
203.description: Said to increase one's happiness at the cost of some energy.
203.effect: Increases happiness by 500 and reduces energy by 25. Includes side effects.

204.name: Speed
204.description: Increases speed for a short period, but lowers dexterity at the same time.
204.effect: Temporarily increases Speed by 20%. Increases happiness by 50. Includes side effects.

205.name: Vicodin
205.description: Temporarily passively increases all statistics while attacking or defending by 25%.
205.effect: Temporarily increases all battle stats by 25%. Increases happiness by 75.

206.name: Xanax
206.effect: Increases energy by 250 and happiness by 75. Includes side effects.

207.name: Ms Torn Crown '07
207.description: Awarded to Vixen_ [140202] for winning the Miss Torn City awards 2007!

209.name: Box of Sweet Hearts
209.description: Fun filled heart shaped candies with messages for your loved ones. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
209.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

210.name: Bag of Chocolate Kisses
210.description: Sweet candy kiss for the one you love. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
210.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

211.name: Crazy Cow
211.description: This is the most Famous Cow of Torn City protector of innocent pets, punisher of the scammer but watch out! Get to close to him and BOOM You have Mad Cow Disease.

212.name: Legend's Urn
212.description: This item is a urn holding all of the ashes of fallen legends killed by the Legend Killer himself.

213.name: Dreamcatcher
213.description: DL's dream catcher. Hung above a bed or in a window, catches bad dreams while good dreams slip on by.

214.name: Brutus Keychain
214.description: This key chain stands as proof the bearer has survived a brush with the mammoth known as Brutus.

215.name: Kitten Plushie
215.description: A small plush kitten. Rumour has it, if you pet its nose it will purr, but is more often heard saying Rawr!

216.name: Single White Rose
216.description: Found only near Valentine's Day in Torn City, this rose would be the perfect gift for your loved one on that special day.

217.name: Claymore Sword
217.description: The claymore is the mother of all broadswords. It's a huge, two-handed thing, approx 4ft long. Do you have the strength to wield this monster?

218.name: Crossbow
218.description: A crossbow has more impact damage than a normal bow and is capable of easily piercing metal.

219.name: Enfield SA-80
219.description: Gas-powered Enfield SA80 rifles have been the weapon of choice for the British Armed Forces since the 1980's. This edition comes with iron sights as standard, but various telescopic sights can be added to increase its aiming accuracy.

220.name: Grenade
220.description: A small hand-held bomb. Pull the pin, count to three, then throw it at your enemy.

221.name: Stick Grenade
221.description: Stick grenades are less powerful and have shorter fuses than their British counterparts, but weigh significantly less.

222.name: Flash Grenade
222.description: Often used to blind opponents, can give an edge in battle that is very hard to overcome.
222.effect: Opponent becomes Blinded, decreasing Speed to 1/5th for 15-20 seconds.

223.name: Jackhammer
223.description: A gas operated, fully automatic only shotgun. Able to fire 240 rounds per minute, this is not your average shotgun.

224.name: Swiss Army Knife
224.description: Elegant and light weight pocket knife, with several useful tools integrated.

225.name: Mag 7
225.description: Shotgun intended specially for close combat and operations in confined spaces, like the room-to-room searches.

226.name: Smoke Grenade
226.description: Typically used to send signals or create a smokescreen, this grenade can be used to temporarily blind your opponent, to allow you the upper hand in attacking.
226.effect: Opponent becomes Smoked, decreasing Speed to 1/3rd for 120-180 seconds.

227.name: Spear
227.description: A spear is an ancient weapon used for hunting and war, consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a sharpened head.

228.name: Vektor CR-21
228.description: Its futuristic looks are the result of the fact that the entire stock is made of a high-impact polymer. The only metal to be seen on the outside is part of the barrel and the flash-suppressor.

229.name: Claymore Mine
229.description: The mine contains 700 steel spheres (10.5 grains) and 1-1/2 pound layer of composition C-4 explosive and is initiated by an electric blasting cap.

230.name: Flare Gun
230.description: Can work as a weapon in a pinch, but only as a last resort.  Works best as a device to create light in some of the darker missions.

231.name: Heckler & Koch SL8
231.description: H&K SL8 is a lightweight semi automatic gas powered rifle. With a unique stock design this dependable weapon is widely sought after.

232.name: SIG 550
232.description: The SIG 550 is a custom assault rifle. With a 20 round magazine this weapon can switch between semi automatic and full automatic firing with a flip of a switch.

233.name: BT MP9
233.description: Offers a lower and more controllable rate of fire compared to other handguns, is also small enough to be effectively fired with one hand.

234.name: Chain Whip
234.description: Oriental version of the flail. Consists of 4 to 6 iron bars linked end to end by short lengths of chain.

235.name: Wooden Nunchakus
235.description: Consists of two wooden bars linked by a short length of chain.

236.name: Kama
236.description: A simple but very sharp and potentially deadly weapon like a small sickle, a favourite of ninjas.

237.name: Kodachi
237.description: This 2-foot blade is considered too short to be classified as a sword, and yet at the same time it is too long to be a dagger. Consisting of a curved, single-edged blade, the Kodachi was wielded by Samurai during Japan's feudal period, and it may also have been used by civilians, who were not permitted to own longer swords such as those used by warriors and officials.

238.name: Sai
238.description: The sai's distinctive shape makes it a versatile weapon. With skill, it can be used effectively against a long sword  by trapping the sword's blade between the sai's blade and the tsuba and breaking it with a twist of the hand.

239.name: Ninja Star
239.description: A lethal throwing weapon that can pierce an opponent's body before they realize an attack is under way. Conceal them, and then throw them underhand at an enemy when they least expect it.

240.name: Type 98 Anti Tank
240.description: Developed by the Chinese in the late ’90s, the Type 98 Anti-Tank is capable of firing unguided, high-explosive 120mm projectiles over a distance of nearly 2km. The weapon can be fired from the shoulder with minimal recoil and has been nicknamed the “Queen Bee” by its proponents.

241.name: Bushmaster Carbon 15
241.description: This top of the line assault weapon weighs less than three and a half pounds. A very effective weapon, regardless of the user's stats.

242.name: HEG
242.description: A fragmentation grenade used to shock and stun the enemy and cause casualties up to a maximum of 190 metres from the point of burst.

243.name: Taurus
243.description: This firearm has been engineered for reliability, accuracy and durability. One of the best low priced weapons you can buy.

244.name: Blowgun
244.description: Most often used with poison darts, can be quite effective if you don't wish your target to know they are under attack until it's far too late.

245.name: Bo Staff
245.description: A long stick carried in the hand. Can't take too much chopping, but its smooth reversal ability makes it a fluid and versatile weapon when used with skill.

246.name: Fireworks
246.description: A fascinating mix of charcoal, sulphur and saltpetre compressed into a bamboo tube.  Traditionally fireworks are the sign of getting rid of the old and welcoming the new. When this is ignited and thrown at an opponent they will get a nasty surprise!

247.name: Katana
247.description: Curved, single-edged sword, or dao, traditionally used by the Japanese samurai. In well trained hands, a deadly weapon.

248.name: Qsz-92
248.description: Most recent development of the Chinese state arms factories. Dual stack magazine holds 15 rounds. Front part of the frame under the barrel is shaped as an accessory rail to accept laser sights or flash lights.

249.name: SKS Carbine
249.description: This gun, with the proper cartridges, will serve for deer hunting, pest and predator control, and emergency self defense.

250.name: Twin Tiger Hooks
250.description: This versatile and lethal weapon combines the abilities of a sword, cane and dagger. Perfect for trapping, blocking and slashing.

251.name: Wushu Double Axes
251.description: This is a pair of lethal axes first forged by the legendary Wushu Warrior Li Kwei. Designed to launch a flurry attack at the enemy, hacking and slashing them to pieces.

252.name: Ithaca 37
252.description: One of the oldest pump action shotguns still in production, this is a favourite of several generations.

253.name: Lorcin 380
253.description: This is the handgun most frequently submitted by law enforcement agencies for tracing in connection to violent crimes. Very low quality, so very much a "use and discard" weapon for short-range attacks.

254.name: S&W M29
254.description: A six shot double action revolver chambered for the .44 Magnum cartridge. It will also chamber and fire .44 Special cartridges.

255.name: Flamethrower
255.description: Built like a backpack, with dual tanks to hold the highly flammable gas. Be careful though, a well placed bullet could be the end of this powerful weapon.. and the person carrying it.

256.name: Tear Gas
256.description: Typically used for riot control, this non-lethal gas will temporarily blind your opponent, possibly giving you a bit of an advantage in battle.
256.effect: Opponent becomes Gassed, decreasing Dexterity to 1/3rd for 120-180 seconds.

257.name: Throwing Knife
257.description: To make the best use of this weapon, skill and practice are needed, but in the right hands, this could be used for a devastating attack.

258.name: Jaguar Plushie
258.description: Modelled after the third largest cat in the world, this small spotted plushie could be easily confused for a leopard.

259.name: Mayan Statue
259.description: Small, dark jade statue of the Mayan God Quetzalcoatl. Quetzalcoatl is the god of human sustenance, penitence, self-sacrifice, re-birth and butterflies.

260.name: Dahlia
260.description: Spectacular pink bloom with pointed petals, this is the national flower of Mexico.

261.name: Wolverine Plushie
261.description: The wolverine has been described as the fiercest creature on earth, but this small plush version will only growl if you pull its tail.

262.name: Hockey Stick
262.description: Replica of the sticks used in the 1920 Olympics, the first year Hockey was recognized as an official Olympic sport. The Winnipeg Falcons had the honour of taking the Gold medal home to Canada.

263.name: Crocus
263.description: This bright blue flower is often considered the national flower of Canada.

264.name: Orchid
264.description: Delicate pink flower, the orchid may not be a native of Hawaii, but it has made the transition to this tropical climate with ease.

265.name: Pele Charm
265.description: Small golden charm of the goddess Pele, bought on your recent trip to the Big Island.

266.name: Nessie Plushie
266.description: Hidden in the depths of the Loch. Seeing this mythical creature will leave a lasting impression.

267.name: Heather
267.description: Believed to bring good luck to who possess it. These spiky purple and white flowers cover the hillsides of Scotland.

268.name: Red Fox Plushie
268.description: Small dark red fox plushie, will serve as a memento from your trip to Britain, and your participation in a local Fox Hunt.

269.name: Monkey Plushie
269.description: Small plush monkey, made in the image of the simians, often seen around the forests of Argentina.

270.name: Soccer Ball
270.description: Replica of the ball used in the 1930 World Cup final between Argentina and Uruguay.

271.name: Ceibo Flower
271.description: This unusual red flower is the national flower of Argentina.

272.name: Edelweiss
272.description: Small white blooms are the hallmark of this Swiss national flower.

273.name: Chamois Plushie
273.description: Small plushie of a Mountain Goat.

274.name: Panda Plushie
274.description: One of the most recognizable endangered species, Xiong Mao, as they are called in Chinese, instantly bring to mind bamboo forests and quiet contemplation.

275.name: Jade Buddha
275.description: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves. - Buddha

276.name: Peony
276.description: While China has no official national flower, the peony, with its ruffled, pale pink blooms, is widely recognized as the national favourite.

277.name: Cherry Blossom
277.description: This beautiful pink blossom is often considered the official flower of Japan.

278.name: Kabuki Mask
278.description: Used in traditional Japanese theatre productions, this beautiful mask can serve as a reminder of your recent trip to Tokyo.

279.name: Maneki Neko
279.description: Meant to bring good fortune and prosperity to its owner, this little cat is more than just a good luck charm.

280.name: Elephant Statue
280.description: This ancient ivory statue is made from the tusks of the very animal it represents,and harvesting the tusks for such artworks is ironically bringing the elephant to the brink of extinction.

281.name: Lion Plushie
281.description: This small plushie is modelled after the African lion. Squeeze his tummy to hear him roar.

282.name: African Violet
282.description: While not the national flower for Africa, this beautiful purple plant will remind you of your recent trip to the Southern African plains.

283.name: Donator Pack
283.description: A Torn City donator pack. Using this will credit you with 31 donator days and give you 50 points!
283.effect: Provides 31 days of donator status and 50 points upon opening.

284.name: Bronze Paint Brush
284.description: This item was given for third place in  one of the many art competitions held by Torn City Staff.

285.name: Silver Paint Brush
285.description: This item was given for second place in  one of the many art competitions held by Torn City Staff.

286.name: Gold Paint Brush
286.description: This item was given for first place in  one of the many art competitions held by Torn City Staff.

287.name: Pand0ra's Box
287.description: After being hidden for years this ancient relic has resurfaced. Mysterious wonders or tragic events await the owner. Open the box if you dare--but following your curiosity may take you down unexpected paths.

288.name: Mr Brownstone Doll
288.description: This rocked out doll will get up around seven Get outta bed around nine And dont worry about nothing 'cause worryin is a waste of ...time.

289.name: Dual Axes
289.description: Only a well trained individual would even dare to attempt to dual wield these weapons.

290.name: Dual Hammers
290.description: Only a well trained individual, ideally with some experience in carpentry, would even dare to attempt to dual wield these weapons.

291.name: Dual Scimitars
291.description: Only a well trained individual would even dare to attempt to dual wield these weapons, and even then only after several puffs on a hookah.

292.name: Dual Samurai Swords
292.description: Only a well trained individual, wearing a classy kimono, would even dare to attempt to dual wield these weapons.

293.name: Japanese/English Dictionary
293.description: This Dictionary can aid you in translating words and symbols from Japanese to English or vice-versa.

294.name: Bottle of Sake
294.description: This is an alcoholic beverage much like wine, made from rice and drunk by Japanese for centuries. Sake is drunk before and after many Japanese events. Provides a small nerve increase when consumed.
294.effect: Increases nerve by 1 and booster cooldown by 1 hour.

295.name: Oriental Log
295.description: This piece of Japanese oak looks ancient. It has Japanese symbols carved all over it. Strangely, written in English on the bottom of the log there is the name 'Master Keneshi'.

296.name: Oriental Log Translation
296.description: On a piece of paper is written: He who chooses to undertake the mastery of dual weaponry need only speak my name.

297.name: YouYou Yo Yo
297.description: You can walk the dog, rock the cradle but be careful, this YouYou YoYo could turn you into meme!

298.name: Monkey Cuffs
298.description: These shiny steel manacles are used by MoNKeY to capture and restrain the bad guys of Torn City. Some lucky ladies hint they have a more naughty purpose!

299.name: Jester's Cap
299.description: A constant reminder that you should never take things too seriously. Wearing this cap will allow you to act a fool and be praised for it.

300.name: Gibal's Dragonfly
300.description: Gibal rides around Torn City on her dragonfly looking for wrong-doers. Once caught they are locked up for good!

301.name: Green Ornament
301.description: This ornament was given to Officers of Torn City for Xmas in recognition of a job well done for their time served as staff.

302.name: Purple Ornament
302.description: This ornament was given to Helpers of Torn City for Xmas in recognition of a job well done for their time served as staff.

303.name: Blue Ornament
303.description: This ornament was given to Mods of Torn City for Xmas in recognition of a job well done for their time served as staff.

304.name: Purple Bell
304.description: This ornament was given to Admins of Torn City for Xmas in recognition of a job well done for their time served as staff.

305.name: Mistletoe
305.description: A kiss under the mistletoe is said to bring good luck for the year ahead. Why not share this tradition with someone special this year?

306.name: Mini Sleigh
306.description: A miniature replica of the very same one Santa uses when delivering presents to the good boys and girls of Torn City.

307.name: Snowman
307.description: Comes complete with silk top hat, button nose and two eyes made out of coal. Perfect winter decoration for any home.

308.name: Christmas Gnome
308.description: A small misshapen mischievous sprite who makes Christmas wishes of 2006 come true.

309.name: Gingerbread House
309.description: Snowdrifts of icing, walls of gingerbread: this house is a replica of the first home decorated for Xmas in Torn City.

310.name: Lollipop
310.description: Tasty fruity candy lolly for lovers, friends, whiny noobs and spoilt brats alike to enjoy! Available in strawberry, blueberry, banana and chocolate flavours. Provides a small happiness increase when consumed.
310.effect: Increases happiness by 25 and booster cooldown by 30 minutes.

311.name: Mardi Gras Beads
311.description: These beads are from the Mardi Gras and thrown by Body. Do you have what it takes to get a set of them?

312.name: Devil Toy
312.description: Tasmanian devil that is. This little fella has been known to create havoc wherever he goes including staff channels, faction forums and anywhere newbies lurk. Rumour has it only Tazzy can control this little whirlwind.

313.name: Cookie Launcher
313.description: A non-working replica of Mix's Cookie launcher, used to launch cookies at his IRC buddies.

314.name: Cursed Moon Pendant
314.description: Be wary of this sacred item. The bearer of this pendant will be put under a spell and become a slave to the evillest of all staff members, Luna. The maker of this pendant cannot be held responsible for any actions you may perform while under its spell. You have been warned.

315.name: Apartment Blueprint
315.description: Designs of an Apartment for construction purposes.

316.name: Semi-Detached House Blueprint
316.description: Designs of a Semi-Detached house for construction purposes.

317.name: Detached House Blueprint
317.description: Designs of a Detached house for construction purposes.

318.name: Beach House Blueprint
318.description: Designs of a Beach house for construction purposes.

319.name: Chalet Blueprint
319.description: Designs of a Chalet for construction purposes.

320.name: Villa Blueprint
320.description: Designs of a Villa for construction purposes.

321.name: Penthouse Blueprint
321.description: Designs of a Penthouse for construction purposes.

322.name: Mansion Blueprint
322.description: Designs of a Mansion for construction purposes.

323.name: Ranch Blueprint
323.description: Designs of a Ranch for construction purposes.

324.name: Palace Blueprint
324.description: Designs of a Palace for construction purposes.

325.name: Castle Blueprint
325.description: Designs of a Castle for construction purposes.

326.name: Printing Paper
326.description: Paper, very similar to the type money is printed on.

328.name: Blank Credit Cards
328.description: Blank credit cards without any data on them.

329.name: Skateboard
329.description: Device used for transportation and entertainment.
329.effect: Permanently increases Speed by 1%. Increases booster cooldown by 6 hours.

330.name: Boxing Gloves
330.description: Worn to protect hands during a boxing event.
330.effect: Permanently increases Defense by 1%. Increases booster cooldown by 6 hours.

331.name: Dumbbells
331.description: Device used to increase muscle mass.
331.effect: Permanently increases Strength by 1%. Increases booster cooldown by 6 hours.

332.name: Combat Vest
332.description: This prototype armor improves on the build of the Outer Tactical Vest to bring its wearer even more protection, making it the lightest, most technologically advanced piece of protective armor ever issued to the Armed Forces of the United States.

333.name: Liquid Body Armor
333.description: Liquid polyethylene glycol and hard nano-particles of silica combined and soaked into all layers of kevlar to make a uniquely flexible and lightweight body armor with amazing stopping power. Top Secret development model!

335.name: Stick of Dynamite
335.description: A small stick of dynamite. This thing could cause a lot of damage if used in the right place...

336.name: Cesium-137
336.description: A man made radioactive element produced by breaking up uranium atoms. It remains dangerous for hundreds of years until losing its radiation.
336.effect: Component used in the construction of a Dirty Bomb

337.name: Dirty Bomb
337.description: A weapon which combines radioactive material with explosives. A dirty bomb would be unlikely to cause many deaths; its main purpose would be to cause a mass panic.
337.effect: Damages a faction's respect and cripples its members with radiation poisoning and hospital time.

338.name: Sh0rty's Surfboard
338.description: Feel the force of Sh0rty's surfboard as he rides past you working his way around Torn City!

339.name: Puzzle Piece
339.description: This oddly shaped item was left over from the last time its owner, Chris, attempted to do a puzzle. Holds some importance....

340.name: Hunny Pot
340.description: This Hunny pot is gold plated and is filled with all the yummy sweetness of honey from contented bees. It is believed to contain the source of Acid's sweetness.

341.name: Seductive Stethoscope
341.description: The enigmatic Drmark uses this cold instrument to pick up the heated flutter of a lovestruck lady or the palpitations of a troubled wrongdoer, keeping the population of Torn City healthy.

342.name: Dollar Bill Collectible
342.description: This item is so rare that only a few bills were printed. It can only be obtained on the item market during Dollar Day Sales. It costs one dollar to purchase, but due to limited printing it is worth a small fortune.

343.name: Backstage Pass
343.description: This backstage pass gave special benefits to its holder by allowing them to have met performers after concerts held by Torn City Radio.

344.name: Chemi's Magic Potion
344.description: This homemade pink brew is powerful, one sip will leave you feeling like you can beat anyone.

345.name: Pack of Trojans
345.description: Magnum rubbers for the gangster who really knows how to use his gun.

346.name: Pair of High Heels
346.description: High Heels - essential weaponry in the control of the male species. Ho or Foe, still can be used to smack an average Joe.

347.name: Thong
347.description: Thongs...Not a wise choice if you have too much junk in your trunk.

348.name: Hazmat Suit
348.description: A fully encapsulating garment worn as protection from hazardous materials or substances.
348.effect: Immunity to Nerve Gas, Tear Gas, Pepper Spray, and Sand

349.name: Flea Collar
349.description: Keep those pesky critters away whilst swinging round the city. A rare must-have before it was discontinued. Reminiscent of golden times. The tag reads "Shadow Still a pup".

350.name: Dunkin's Donut
350.description: The feeling of invincibility gained by eating one of these cream filled masterpieces has been known to make HOF factions tremble with fear.

351.name: Amazon Doll
351.description: Modeled after Wild_Irish_Btch, this doll shows that women can stomp your face into the ground while towering above the men of Torn City. Doll comes equipped with a bag of Cheetos, a Teddy Bear plushie, a replica of Brutus, and an avid love of midgets.

352.name: BBQ Smoker
352.description: You have to be pretty fast to steal the brisket inside this smoker. Which just happened to be stolen right after this collectible was made. Body and a drifter hobo were both seen eating brisket in the vicinity shortly afterwards. st0ne was last seen crying in his backyard.

353.name: Bag of Cheetos
353.description: A jumbo bag of these orange cheese twists for late nights on the job. Favored by midgets of all types.

354.name: Motorbike
354.description: You can often find Numbat tearing it up through the city's darkest streets on this, seeking prey. Beware the spiked tires!

355.name: Citrus Squeezer
355.description: Commonly used by lem0n to put the squeeze on during lengthy interrogations. Also handy to make a refreshing drink on a warm day.

356.name: Superman Shades
356.description: Said to bestow Superman-like powers on the wearer, these ordinary looking shades are rumoured to make all of your stats appear the same.

357.name: Kevlar Helmet
357.description: Standard infantry combat wear in the US military. The shell is made from kevlar, a ballistic aramid fabric treated with a phenolic resin system.

358.name: Raw Ivory
358.description: A raw elephant tusk. A hard, smooth yellowish-white substance.

359.name: Fine Chisel
359.description: A tool with a cutting edge on its end. This particular type of chisel can be used to sculpt ivory.

360.name: Ivory Walking Cane
360.description: A handmade walking cane. Used by some of the oldest citizens in Torn City, helping them to get around while they commit various crimes and attend physiotherapy gym sessions.

361.name: Neumune Tablet
361.description: Neumune, an androstenediol, was introduced as a radiation countermeasure by the US Armed Forces Radiobiology Research Institute and has begun production in Switzerland.  Neumune is in Investigational New Drug (IND) status and Phase I trials have been performed.
361.effect: Reduces radiation hospital time by 3 hours and radiation effect by 12 hours. Increases medical cooldown by 3 hours.
361.requirement: Under the effect of radiation poisoning.

362.name: Mr Torn Crown '08
362.description: Awarded to -KC [130919] for winning the Mr Torn City awards 2008!

363.name: Ms Torn Crown '08
363.description: Awarded to AylaTayla [350383] for winning the Miss Torn City awards 2008!

364.name: Box of Grenades
364.description: A box of 100 grenades, courtesy of the Eaglewood mercenary group.
364.effect: Provides 100 Grenades or 100 HEGs when opened.

365.name: Box of Medical Supplies
365.description: A box of medical supplies, courtesy of the Torn City Health Service.
365.effect: Provides 20 Morphine, 20 Empty Blood Bags, 30 First Aid Kits, or 50 Small First Aid Kits when opened.

366.name: Erotic DVD
366.description: An Erotic DVD, courtesy of the Performance Ribaldry Network.
366.effect: Increases happiness by 2,500 and booster cooldown by 6 hours.

367.name: Feathery Hotel Coupon
367.description: A coupon to stay at one of the world's best hotels, courtesy of the Feathery Hotels Group.
367.effect: Refills energy. Increases happiness by 500 and booster cooldown by 6 hours.

368.name: Lawyer Business Card
368.description: This card has the number of a professional defense lawyer on it, courtesy of the Legal Authorities Group.
368.effect: Removes all jail time and increases booster cooldown by 1 hour.

369.name: Lottery Voucher
369.description: A lottery voucher which can be traded in for 100 lottery tickets for the weekly draw, courtesy of the Lucky Shot Casino.
369.effect: Provides 100 Lucky Shot Lotto tickets when used.

370.name: Drug Pack
370.description: A drug pack from Symbiotic Ltd. Contains either 10x Xanax or 10x Vicodin.
370.effect: Provides 10 Xanax or 10 Vicodin when opened.

371.name: Dark Doll
371.description: Legend has it that this doll was made in the darkest depths of a castle by the typing of a keyboard. It is said that whenever someone needs help, another thread is woven deep within the doll.

372.name: Empty Box
372.description: An empty box. Items can be placed in to this box turning it into a parcel. It can then be sent to other people.
372.effect: Can be filled with items to create a Parcel.

373.name: Parcel
373.description: A parcel containing one or more items.
373.effect: Can be opened to receive the items inside.

374.name: Birthday Present
374.description: A birthday present, containing one or more items.
374.effect: Can be opened to receive the items inside.

375.name: Present
375.description: A present neatly wrapped with generic wrapping paper, containing one or more items.
375.effect: Can be opened to receive the items inside.

376.name: Christmas Present
376.description: A Christmas present, containing one or more items.
376.effect: Can be opened to receive the items inside.

377.name: Birthday Wrapping Paper
377.description: A roll of expensive birthday wrapping paper. Can be used on a parcel to turn it into a birthday present.
377.effect: Wraps parcels turning them into Birthday Presents.

378.name: Generic Wrapping Paper
378.description: A roll of standard wrapping paper. Can be used on a parcel to turn it into a present.
378.effect: Wraps parcels turning them into Presents.

379.name: Christmas Wrapping Paper
379.description: A roll of expensive Christmas wrapping paper. Can be used on a parcel to turn it into a Christmas present.
379.effect: Wraps parcels turning them into Christmas Presents.

380.name: Small Explosive Device
380.description: A very small explosive device. Generally used in parcels to give the opener a nasty surprise.
380.effect: Can be hidden inside a parcel to hospitalize someone for 5 hours upon opening.

381.name: Gold Laptop
381.description: Stun others with this exclusive limited edition solid gold laptop. Crafted from one single block of 99.9% pure gold. Use it while travelling, if your arms can bear the weight.
381.effect: Can be used to access additional services while traveling and program viruses.

382.name: Gold Plated AK-47
382.description: One of the best rifles in the world, made even better. This highly tuned, gold plated AK-47 Kalashnikov will send fear coursing through the blood of your enemies. Configured to fire an extended magazine of ammunition, it's not the cheapest, but it'll certainly leave a mark.

383.name: Platinum PDA
383.description: This luxury, platinum plated personal data assistant has a large storage area for contacts. Boosting your friend and enemy capacity by 500, you'll never be without company again.
383.effect: Increases friends list and enemies list capacity by +500.

384.name: Camel Plushie
384.description: This rare camel plushie will instantly remind you of Arabian nights within the U.A.E.

385.name: Tribulus Omanense
385.description: Originating in the desert, and soon to become Dubai's official flower, the Tribulus Omanense is a hermaphroditic flower that can survive very harsh conditions.

386.name: Sports Sneakers
386.description: This pair of limited edition sneakers will prove their value in the gym. Rumoured to increase speed gains by up to 5%, these lightweight and durable shoes will leave your enemies in the dust.
386.effect: Increases speed gains in the gym by 5%.

387.name: Handbag
387.description: A platinum plated handbag to keep thieves at bay. Its diamond studs will deliver a nasty blow to any opponent.

388.name: Pink Mac-10
388.description: Don't let the pink fool you. With a seriously extended magazine this rapid fire, automatic, sub machine-gun will mow down enemies with ease.

389.name: Mr Torn Crown '09
389.description: Awarded to GodsCurse [785385] for winning the Mr Torn City awards 2009!

390.name: Ms Torn Crown '09
390.description: Awarded to Lullsbud [945705] for winning the Miss Torn City awards 2009!

391.name: Macana
391.description: This South American dagger with a handle of the finest Amazon timber is sharper than it looks. This extremely light, hand crafted weapon is very accurate.

392.name: Pepper Spray
392.description: The spray contains 200 grams of weapons grade pepper, and once fired can incapacitate your opponent for several seconds. Perfect for that extra edge during a fight.
392.effect: Opponent becomes Maced, decreasing Dexterity to 1/5th for 15-20 seconds.

393.name: Slingshot
393.description: This weapon is perfect against a more powerful opponent, although contrary to popular opinion, it was a sling, not a slingshot, which was used by David against Goliath. Thank you to the ******* pedant who pointed this out.

394.name: Brick
394.description: The brick is a crude way to disable your opponent, but it's easily acquired from any DIY store or building site, and deadly if you can hit your target in a tender spot.

395.name: Metal Nunchakus
395.description: The Metal Nunchakus are easily concealed when folded, but once opened become a weapon with lethal force for someone with Martial Arts training.

396.name: Business Class Ticket
396.description: If you want to travel in style and comfort, the only way to do this is to travel in business class. Stretch your legs and relax. You can use this two way ticket at the travel agency, and you'll be at your destination before you know it!
396.effect: Provides a return business class trip which reduces flight duration by 70%. Grants a base travel capacity of 15.

397.name: Flail
397.description: Used by knights in ancient times, it is still a devastating weapon in the right hands. This very rare medieval flail is highly inaccurate but will deliver a massive blow to anyone standing in its way.

398.name: SIG 552
398.description: This rifle is a very powerful weapon and comes with a folding leaf sight.

399.name: ArmaLite M-15A4
399.description: Made from the latest composites, this lightweight but powerful rifle is perfect for the experienced shooter.

400.name: Guandao
400.description: This Chinese pole weapon has a heavy blade, and a rear spike for when you swing it back around. Truly a weapon for the finest assassins. Not the best accuracy but hits hard!

401.name: Lead Pipe
401.description: The lead pipe is quite clumsy and heavy, but a big swing can result in some devastating damage to your opponent.

402.name: Ice Pick
402.description: Nice and light, the ice pick is easy to handle, but is very sharp and can cause significant damage. Also useful for preparing drinks at parties after a hard week of crime.

403.name: Box of Tissues
403.description: The perfect present to dry the tears of your opponent in battle. If you win, that is.
403.effect: Increases happiness by 5-20 if under 20% of maximum.

404.name: Bandana
404.description: Always nice to wear on warm summer days walking around the city. But be careful as sometimes it's the mark of a gang member.

405.name: Loaf of Bread
405.description: Considered the staple of many diets, bread tastes best when covered slightly with butter or margarine.

406.name: Afro Comb
406.description: Perfect for those bad hair days when your hair just will not behave, the afro comb will get you ready for your date on time.

407.name: Compass
407.description: This was the GPS of its time, and it made sure that weary travellers could find their way even in the most difficult conditions.

408.name: Sextant
408.description: Modern cruiseliners do not need a sextant these days, but they are made from the finest bronze and adorn many a Captain's cabin.

409.name: Yucca Plant
409.description: Native to hot and dry climates, this ornamental plant has tough sword shaped leaves. It is also the state flower of New Mexico and is perfect for your island garden.

410.name: Fire Hydrant
410.description: The Fire Hydrant is needed in case of fire, especially if you have invested heavily in your property and you want the firemen to put the flames out more quickly.

411.name: Model Space Ship
411.description: This ship is made of die cast metal and has red LED lights. You can sit back and think about travelling where no one has gone before.

412.name: Sports Shades
412.description: The ultimate accessory when driving your GT40 with the top down on the highway, these shades are made from a non scratch material. One pair of these last a lifetime.

413.name: Mountie Hat
413.description: Worn by the Canadian Mounted Police while on duty, it can keep your head warm and dry or keep the sun out of your eyes.

414.name: Proda Sunglasses
414.description: The ultimate in city chic, these should only be worn when you want to dress to impress.

415.name: Ship in a Bottle
415.description: People always wonder how the ship got inside the bottle. If you look closely at this amazing ornament you can see tiny sailors on the deck.

416.name: Paper Weight
416.description: This piece of office equipment has many uses, not just for keeping paper under control on a busy desk. Truly a multi function device.

417.name: RS232 Cable
417.description: This miracle of modern computing technology is rumoured to be able to connect absolutely any two devices together.

418.name: Tailors Dummy
418.description: This dummy is not only great to try out your latest designs on. It can keep you company on lonely evenings or even serve as a deterrent to would be burglars.

419.name: Small Suitcase
419.description: The suitcase is something the frequent traveller cannot be without, and this one has a special lead lined hidden compartment should you need to carry contraband. This particular model will allow you to carry 2 more items back with you.
419.effect: Increases travel capacity by +2. Does not stack with other suitcases.

420.name: Medium Suitcase
420.description: The suitcase is something the frequent traveller cannot be without, and this one has a special lead lined hidden compartment should you need to carry contraband. This particular model will allow you to carry 3 more items back with you.
420.effect: Increases travel capacity by +3. Does not stack with other suitcases.

421.name: Large Suitcase
421.description: The suitcase is something the frequent traveller cannot be without, and this one has a special lead lined hidden compartment should you need to carry contraband. This particular model will allow you to carry 4 more items back with you.
421.effect: Increases travel capacity by +4. Does not stack with other suitcases.

422.name: Vanity Hand Mirror
422.description: This compact mirror is ideal to check yourself out before the big date.
422.effect: Can be used to check appearance.

423.name: Poker Chip
423.description: A very rare, lucky poker chip. Carry this in your pocket in your next big tournament; hopefully it will bring you good luck.

424.name: Rabbit Foot
424.description: This is said to bestow good luck and fortune for those who own one, but be careful: losing it brings massive bad luck.

425.name: Voodoo Doll
425.description: This doll is for sale to unsuspecting tourists who assume it is a long forgotten art, only to run into bad luck once they return home.

426.name: Bottle of Tequila
426.description: Full to begin with, empty at the end, be sure to bring one of these back from your holidays in Mexico. Provides a small nerve increase when consumed.
426.effect: Increases nerve by 1 and booster cooldown by 1 hour.

427.name: Sumo Doll
427.description: Whether it be from fear or respect, you definitely need to hold this doll in high regard.

428.name: Casino Pass
428.description: The perfect gift for the avid gambler, this pass allows you to stay and gamble after hours, so you can try to make your losses back.

429.name: Chopsticks
429.description: You can't go to Japan without giving your next meal a chance with a pair of these chopsticks. Definitely a must have item and experience while visiting.

430.name: Coconut Bra
430.description: While traveling in Hawaii and enjoying the amazing beaches they offer, don't forget your Hawaiian attire!

431.name: Dart Board
431.description: Be sure to stop in to the local pub for a quick game of darts while visiting London.

432.name: Crazy Straw
432.description: Bend them, stretch them, do as you please with them, but don't get caught without one in your drink.

433.name: Sensu
433.description: The traditional Japanese fan can be used to keep you cool, or placed for a traditional Japanese look in any room.

434.name: Yakitori Lantern
434.description: This bright red lantern will help guide to the nearest Yakitori stall for a quick bite to eat.

435.name: Dozen White Roses
435.description: When you need just that special gift, nothing says it better than a dozen pure white roses. Specially selected, very rare and expensive flowers.

436.name: Snowboard
436.description: This is a must have accessory when visiting the slopes in Switzerland.

437.name: Glow Stick
437.description: They come in many colors and make the perfect accessory for a night out in the city with your friends.

438.name: Cricket Bat
438.description: Made from the finest willow and protected with linseed oil, this bat can literally knock your opponent for six.

439.name: Frying Pan
439.description: Usually used in the kitchen, it can be a very handy weapon if nothing else is to hand. Makes a loud noise on contact so make sure no witnesses are around.

440.name: Pillow
440.description: Filled with the finest duck feathers, it is hard to miss your opponent with this pillow. Make sure you swing hard as it is very soft to the touch.

441.name: Khinkeh P0rnStar Doll
441.description: This doll can only be possessed by the most deviant, twisted and gifted of sexually explicit individuals.  Its owner will soon find their senses heightened their stamina full and their abilities peaked.

442.name: Blow-Up Doll
442.description: This item is a Collectable fake female, after all there are no girlz on the interwebz. Good set of lungs required. Puncture proof guaranteed!

443.name: Strawberry Milkshake
443.description: Made with extra loving care by Hate_Train with some of his favorite special ingredients. This is an amazingly tasty and refreshing treat the entire family can enjoy. Or is it?

444.name: Breadfan Doll
444.description: This doll is quite harmless unless provoked. Then it's Screw it all with no regrets. If you have drawn his shortest straw, sleep with one eye open. Here comes the Harvester of sorrow. Your life will be blackened by the God that failed.

445.name: Chaos Man
445.description: The name of this guy strikes fear into everyone. But on the inside he is all soft and tender. Filled with innocence, Chaos Man is best handled with a nice warm hug.

446.name: Karate Man
446.description: This karate master bruises on the inside, and be careful not to get too close as he has a kung fu grip. KACHOW!

447.name: Burmese Flag
447.description: This flag represents what the secretary Baalsagoth spends most of his day admiring. Huge IP's and broken browsers surely will follow.

448.name: Bl0ndie's Dictionary
448.description: When your spelling is as bad as 'the typo queen' Bl0ndie's you will always need to carry a dictionary. Also gives a mighty whack when used to hit people who bring up her mistakes.

449.name: Hydroponic Grow Tent
449.description: This tent can be set up in any small space and every crop will easily generate more than enough Skunk to keep even Hydr0 well stoned into the wee hours! Own one of these and you no longer have to pay the man, You can be the man!

450.name: Leopard Coin
450.description: An attempt by Edward III to produce a gold coin to be used internationally, much like the Florin but only half of the value. The Leopard bore the following Latin legend: 'DOMINE NE IN FURORE TUO ARGUAS ME', meaning: 'O Lord, rebuke me not in Thy anger'. The Florin was recalled and melted down in 1344 to produce the Noble. Few specimens have survived of what is often regarded as one of the most beautiful medieval coins ever produced.

451.name: Florin Coin
451.description: An English coin based on a French coin, and issued in Florence, Italy in 1252. The Florin was made from gold and was intended as an international coin, however the gold it was made from was overvalued and the coin was not accepted by international merchants. The coin was then withdrawn from circulation and melted down to form the Noble. Because of this, the Florin is very rare.

452.name: Gold Noble Coin
452.description: The first mass-produced English coin, preceded by the Florin, the gold Noble was valued at six shillings and eight pence. The coin was introduced in 1344, and weighed 138.5 grains, later reduced to 128.5 grains. Mentioned in Shakespeare's plays, this coin is sought after by museums and private collectors.

453.name: Ganesha Sculpture
453.description: Also known as Ganapati, worshipped widely throughout Hindu India as the remover of obstacles. Ganesha has figured often in Indian art since around 100 AD. This rare work is made from gold and is highly sought after as part of a set of South Asian artifacts.

454.name: Vairocana Buddha Sculpture
454.description: The Vairocana Buddha is an embodiment of Dharmakaya. It is well known as the generalised depiction of the historical Gautama Buddha.Throughout Asia the image has different meanings: in Tibet - 'the illuminator' and in Japan - 'great sun'. Not as common as other Buddhist sculptures, this valuable gold specimen is a great collector's item.

455.name: Quran Script : Ibn Masud
455.description: The Qur'an, which in Arabic means 'the recitation', is recognized by Muslims as the main miracle of prophet Muhammad, and is a compilation of divine messages. It is a book of guidance as opposed to an account of specific events. This particular script is the Ibn Masud version, and is extremely valuable in a set of all three versions.

456.name: Quran Script : Ubay Ibn Kab
